English[edit]

English Wikipedia has an article on:
circa
Wikipedia

Alternative forms[edit]

  • ca., ca, or c.; rarely cca. or cir. (abbreviations)

Etymology[edit]

Borrowed from Latin circa.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (UK) IPA(key): /ˈsɜːkə/
  • (US) IPA(key): /ˈsɝkə/
  • Rhymes: -ɜː(r)kə
  • Hyphenation: cir‧ca

Preposition[edit]

circa

  1. Approximately, about.
    Julius Caesar visited this area circa 50 BC.

Translations[edit]

approximately, about
  • Arabic: حَوَالِي‎ (ḥawālī)
    Egyptian Arabic: حوالي‎ (ḥawalii)
  • Armenian: մոտ (hy) (mot), մոտավորապես (hy) (motavorapes)
  • Bulgarian: около (bg) (okolo), приблизително (bg) (priblizitelno)
  • Catalan: circa (ca)
  • Chinese:
    Mandarin: 大約 (zh), 大约 (zh) (dàyuē)
  • Czech: přibližně (cs), cirka (cs)
  • Danish: cirka (da)
  • Dutch: circa (nl)
  • Faroese: umleið
  • Finnish: noin (fi)
  • French: (with a measure) environ (fr), (with a date) vers (fr)
  • Georgian: დაახლოებით (daaxloebit)
  • German: ungefähr (de), etwa (de), um (de), circa (de), zirka (de)
  • Greek: περίπου (el) (perípou), περ. (per.)
  • Hebrew: בקירוב‎ (be'qiruv)
  • Icelandic: um það bil (is), circa, sirka
  • Italian: circa (it)
  • Japanese: 約… (ja) (yaku), 大体… (ja) (daitai), …位 (ja) (kurai; gurai), …頃 (ja) (…ごろ, goro), およそ… (ja) (oyoso)
  • Korean: ...경 (ko) (...頃, ...gyeong), 대략 (ko) (daelyak)
  • Persian: حوالی‎ (fa) (havâli-ye)
  • Polish: około (pl)
  • Portuguese: cerca de, aproximadamente (pt)
  • Russian: приблизи́тельно (ru) (priblizítelʹno), приме́рно (ru) (primérno), о́коло (ru) (ókolo) (+ genitive case)
  • Spanish: cerca de, aproximadamente (es)

Anagrams[edit]

  • ARCIC, Ricca, craic

Italian[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Borrowed from Latin circa.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈtʃir.ka/
  • Hyphenation: cìr‧ca

Preposition[edit]

circa

  1. regarding, concerning

Adverb[edit]

circa

  1. about, approximately

Anagrams[edit]

  • ricca

Latin[edit]

Etymology[edit]

A later form for circum, or from circum + eā.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /ˈkir.kaː/, [ˈkɪr.kaː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /ˈt͡ʃir.ka/

Adverb[edit]

circā (not comparable)

  1. around; about

Preposition[edit]

circā (+ accusative)

  1. around; near; about
  2. regarding, concerning

Related terms[edit]

  • circus

Descendants[edit]

  • Asturian: cerca, cierca
  • Catalan: cerca, circa
  • Dutch: circa
  • English: circa
  • French: circa
  • German: circa
  • Italian: circa
  • Portuguese: cerca
  • Romanian: circa
  • Sicilian: circa
  • Spanish: cerca, circa

  • circa in Charles du Fresne du Cange’s Glossarium Mediæ et Infimæ Latinitatis (augmented edition, 1883–1887)
  • circa in Gaffiot, Félix (1934) Dictionnaire Illustré Latin-Français, Hachette
  • circa in Ramminger, Johann (accessed 16 July 2016) Neulateinische Wortliste: Ein Wörterbuch des Lateinischen von Petrarca bis 1700‎[1], pre-publication website, 2005-2016

Romanian[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Borrowed from Latin circa.

Adverb[edit]

circa

  1. approximately, about, or so

Synonyms[edit]
